meanings.definition: Beat severely in a fight or contest.
meanings.sent1: During the match, the boxer managed to drub his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent2: The team was able to drub their rivals in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The superhero drubbed the villain in an epic showdown.
meanings.sent4: The storm drubbed the coast with relentless waves.
meanings.sent5: The drummers drubbed their drums with great enthusiasm at the concert.

meanings.sent1: The chess champion was able to drub all opponents in the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team managed to drub their opponents with a score of 5-0.
meanings.sent3: The students drubbed the teachers in the annual quiz competition.
meanings.sent4: The new technology drubbed the old methods in efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays drubbed down on the beach, making it a hot day.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter had to drub the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer continued to drub his opponent with quick jabs.
meanings.sent3: The raindrops drubbed against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The woodpecker drubbed on the tree trunk looking for insects.
meanings.sent5: The drummer's sticks drubbed on the drum set creating a rhythmic beat.
